thread.title: Comm Bank weighs on Aust market
thread.title_full: Comm Bank weighs on Aust market

title: Comm Bank weighs on Aust market
text:
Tue, Aug 18, 2015, 10:52 AM AEST - Australia Markets close in 5 hrs 8 mins Comm Bank weighs on Aust market AAP â€“ 7 minutes ago Print 
Australian shares have opened fairly steadily but the Commonwealth Bank, which is trading ex-dividend, is weighing upon the market. 
CMC Markets chief market analyst Ric Spooner said overseas bourses were up a bit, and commodity prices were fairly settled. 
"That's fed through into a fairly steady opening," he said. 
"The Commonwealth Bank going ex-dividend today has been a drag on the index." 
"The other thing is we're being very much influenced by (company earnings) results today." 
Among the major banks, at 1021 AEST, ANZ was four cents lower at $29.48 after its lifted its cash profit four per cent to $5.4 billion for the first nine months of its fiscal year but was hit with higher bad debt charges. 
The Commonwealth Bank was down $1.98 at $79.29, but National Australia Bank was 23 cents richer at $32.38, and Westpac had climbed 50 cents at $32.44. 
In the resources sector, global miner BHP Billiton was steady at $25.20, Rio Tinto had lifted seven cents to $50.96, and Fortescue Metals cents had put on 12 cents to $1.96. 
Insurer QBE rose 23 cents to $14.20 after lifting its first half profit 24 per cent and increasing its dividend to shareholders. 
Australia's largest rail and freight operator Asciano was in a trading halt after it agreed to a $12 billion takeover by Canada's Brookfield Infrastructure Group. 
Electronics retailer Dick Smith plunged 18.5 cents, or 9.25 per cent, to $1.815 after it lifted its full year profit three per cent, with restructuring costs offsetting stronger sales. 
KEY FACTS 
* At 1029 AEST on Tuesday, the benchmark S&P/ASX200 index was down 4.7 points, or 0.09 per cent, at 5,363.0 points. 
* The broader All Ordinaries index was down 3.2 points, or 0.06 per cent, at 5,365.4 points. 
* The September share price index futures contract was 10 points higher at 5,312 points, with 11,848 contracts traded. 
* National turnover was 259.98 million securities worth $564.3 million. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook
